title: Kinetic friction - coefficient of kinetic friction

content.question: A student of mass <math alttext="45 kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>45</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> slides down a ramp that is inclined at an angle of <math alttext="30 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>30</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> above the horizontal. The magnitude of the student’s acceleration is <math alttext="2 meters per second squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><msup><mtext>m/s</mtext><mn>2</mn></msup></math>. The coefficient of kinetic friction between the student and the ramp is most nearly

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
